title: Riot can we please fix the delete/bumping abuse or make self-deleted posts reportable for spam?
body:
Since making a thread about the person wasn't ok, maybe making a thread to complain about how it works in general is ok.

And I made a thread because it's an exploit to **avoid **reports, so I can **not **report it because of how it works.

And you asked me to use your support tickets which have long removed the option to report anything, so how I am even suppose to get to support by filing it under something random and irrelevant and hope you see it?

replies.body: Why should you not be allowed to bump a discussion? Must they die in oblivion if they don't get a comment in the first 10 minutes and fall off the first page? And don't say "if they don't get a comment they're not interesting." I've had plenty of discussions that didn't make it during my first attempt(s) but were at the top of the hot list after a few tries/bumps. But since bumping is somehow illegal on these forums (I don't get it, all other forums have a button that allows you to bump), I guess we just need to create a slightly different new thread each time.
There really should be a bump button with a cooldown of 3 hours or so.

> [{quoted}](name=Dr Poro,realm=EUW,application-id=bzRrPGQO,discussion-id=AKRHE8xf,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-07-21T21:13:38.704+0000)
>
> Why should you not be allowed to bump a discussion? Must they die in oblivion if they don't get a comment in the first 10 minutes and fall off the first page? And don't say "if they don't get a comment they're not interesting." I've had plenty of discussions that didn't make it during my first attempt(s) but were at the top of the hot list after a few tries/bumps. But since bumping is somehow illegal on these forums (I don't get it, all other forums have a button that allows you to bump), I guess we just need to create a slightly different new thread each time.

You're allowed to bump the discussion if you can provide something new, useful, or commenting on part of the discussions or just being relevant to thread at all. 

You aren't allowed to bump with empty & spammy content because "you feel like it" ie "bump" or deleting the post. 

And it's because if everyone was doing it every new thread would die before it gets a chance.

> [{quoted}](name=Kagami,realm=NA,application-id=bzRrPGQO,discussion-id=AKRHE8xf,comment-id=00030002,timestamp=2015-07-21T23:17:26.370+0000)
>
> You're allowed to bump the discussion if you can provide something new, useful, or commenting on part of the discussions or just being relevant to thread at all. 
> 
> You aren't allowed to bump with empty & spammy content because "you feel like it" ie "bump" or deleting the post. 
> 
> And it's because if everyone was doing it every new thread would die before it gets a chance.

That's dumb, and really a waste of 90% of people even making threads.

Also if people are going to be "punished" for deleting a post, then that is equally as ignorant. Sometimes I will make a mistake and respond to the wrong person, or in some cases respond to the wrong thread when I have multiple windows open. So I shouldn't be allowed to delete my post?

That's just dumb, and if Riot starts punishing people for that kind of stuff, these boards are going to become even more hated by the community than they already are, and there will be no people left to care to post, and everyone will just full on move to Reddit, as depressing as that is. 


Riot is doing nothing to improve the boards, and just doing stuff that annoys people with them.

- No one wanted the new boards, they wanted to keep GD
- The color scheme is STILL terrible and they have ignored that feedback since they opened the boards
- Riot wants the most "popular" threads to rise to the top, but you'll never get any attention if you can't even bump a thread to get it seen through the b.s. 
- The mobile site is just terrible and shouldn't have been released, but releasing things half finished is starting to become a trend (or just never releasing things at all).
- The new "rules" seem a little bit overboard given how little moderation there has been since they opened these boards. Especially since the only moderation is *delete post* with no warning or reason, and in some cases deleting posts that shouldn't have been, while not deleting others that they should.


The boards are not exactly improving, and Riot ignoring feedback that is actually relevant, while even bothering to respond to a thread asking for punishment for bumping a thread, is exactly why people give them so much shit.

I had a thread started about a new writer Riot was hiring (somehow before Riot themselves mentioned it) and not a single person commented in about an hour.

I bumped it for vision and it was commented on rather heavily for about 3 days afterwards.

Not being able to bump is just dumb. The new rules seem a bit too strict, which is hilarious compared to the opposite approach Riot takes in the actual game, where they are no where near strict enough with trolls and the like.

I'll put this in my list of features which I'm interested in.

For now, you can send in a support ticket to us for those who are abusing this method of bumping. There might not be a correct category but it will definitely get into my hands and I can assist you there.

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new
Why are the boards even still like this? I thought the majority consensus was that most people preferred the older/better layout of the forums...
Why do you find the boards ugly. I don't. Even so, you come here to chat not to view boards like a Art museum. Atleast we have a place to post discussions etc. It is better than nothing.

Then could you specify that? It's quite relevant--

GD disables vote sorting; hides vote count from a thread before you open it; etc., so in GD bumps carry weight to 100% of the user base but this is not so for any other subboard.

:/ Specifying GD is important here, and in the case of GD, I agree that this is an issue, but in every other subboard it isn't.

However, if you don't have mods that actually understand when evaluating these cases?

You will get me and Angelus banned because of [Wirym](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/4GiEBtUP-wirym-the-soul-siphoning-spirit) and [Ephrial](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/dEnNWeRQ-champion-concept-ephrial-the-blazing-swordsman) who both have basically nothing in their comments sections but bumps.

Because of a lot of reasons, but those bumps are well spread out (at least a day)-- is that spam to you, Kagami?

The boards move far too fast, and without bumping sometimes, even a relevant thread will be completely forgotten, because realistically it will never be seen. I just think of all the real issues to be fixed, worrying about someone bumping a thread a few times is about as bottom of the barrel scraping as you can get right now.
